Your target Python program is a loop to find the maximum value in an array. Here's a loop invariant for the i-th iteration of the loop:


```python
max_value_i = arr[i]
while j < len(arr):
    if arr[j] > max_value_i:
        max_value_i = arr[j]
    j += 1
return max_value_i
```
This invariant ensures that the maximum value found so far is updated correctly and that the loop terminates when it encounters a larger value. It also ensures that `max_value_i` is initialized with the correct value for the first iteration.

```python
max_value_i = arr[i]
j = i
while j <= len(arr) - 1:
    if arr[j] > max_value_i:
        max_value_i = arr[j]
    j += 1
return max_value_i
```
This invariant ensures that the maximum value found so far is updated correctly and that the loop terminates when it encounters a larger value. It also ensures that `max_value_i` is initialized with the correct value for the first iteration, as specified by your function name. Note that this invariant only ensures the correctness of the program in case there are duplicate values in the array, which you seem to have included in your loop conditions (by writing `len(arr) - 1` instead of just `len(arr)`).
